intro: Polycoelium chinense, commonly known as the Chinese polycoelium, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The botanical features of Polycoelium chinense make it an interesting subject for both ecological and pharmacological studies.
